info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 2:26PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR RAPID REDUCTIONS OF VISIBILITIES IN SNOW SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON... WEATHER... * Scattered snow showers will impact the Metro Detroit, Ann Arbor, and Howell areas through the afternoon hours. IMPACTS... * Moderate to briefly heavy snowfall will cause reductions of visibility to less than one mile at times. There may be rapid fluctuations of visibility. * Slick spots may develop on area roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps, and overpasses. A dusting of snow is possible on untreated roads. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * The combination of moderate to heavy snow and strong winds will result in localized white out conditions. Reduced visibilities and some slick spots will cause variable traffic rates throughout the area. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
